steps.title: Yes, colloidal oatmeal can soothe itchy, irritated skin.
steps.content: Yes, colloidal oatmeal can soothe itchy, irritated skin. Oatmeal has been used for centuries to relieve skin irritation. Today, colloidal oatmeal is available in different forms and dosages in products such as shampoos, shaving gels, and moisturizing creams. Colloidal oatmeal is full of chemicals that protect and heal skin as well as contain anti-inflammatory properties. steps.title: Make an oatmeal bath to soak in the benefits of colloidal oatmeal.
steps.content: Make an oatmeal bath to soak in the benefits of colloidal oatmeal. Place about 1 cup (90 grams) of raw, unflavored oats in a blender or food processor and grind them down until they reach a fine, powdered texture. Pour the ground oats into a warm bath and stir them into the water. Soak in the tub for 15-30 minutes to soothe and heal your skin. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Only if you don’t like feeling sticky afterward.
steps.content: Only if you don’t like feeling sticky afterward. Soak for a solid 10-15 minutes so your skin absorbs all of the beneficial chemicals from the colloidal oatmeal. If you feel sticky when you’re done, you can rinse off in tepid water to remove the residue from your skin. Then, you can pat or blot yourself dry with a towel, but don’t rub your skin, which can cause irritation. [3] X Research source

steps.title: It’s good for itchy, irritated skin.
steps.content: It’s good for itchy, irritated skin. Oatmeal preparations have been shown to possess antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties that can help soothe itchy skin, treat acne, and even help heal viral infections. [4] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Oatmeal soaps can help improve your skin and won’t irritate it like harsher soaps can. You can even make your own oatmeal soap at home!

steps.title: Yes, it’s possible to be allergic to colloidal oatmeal.
steps.content: Yes, it’s possible to be allergic to colloidal oatmeal. Because it’s essentially finely ground oats, colloidal oatmeal contains proteins that some people can be allergic to. So, if you have an oat allergy, you can have a reaction if you use products that contain colloidal oatmeal. If you start developing itchy skin or a rash after using colloidal oatmeal, stop using it. You may be allergic to the oat protein. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Yes, you can!
steps.content: Yes, you can! Colloidal oatmeal comes in a variety of products like creams, shampoos, and body washes. They’re safe to use every day to help relieve skin irritation and itchiness. However, if you start to have a reaction or you develop a rash, stop using the colloidal oatmeal to see if that’s causing it. [6] X Research source
